required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Duration of Long Acting Muscarinic Antagonist (LAMA) Bronchoprotection Against Methacholine Challenge
clinical_study.official_title: Duration of Bronchoprotection of the Long Acting Muscarinic Antagonists Tiotropium and Glycopyrronium Against Methacholine Induced Bronchoconstriction

brief_summary.textblock: The study will assess the duration of protection of single doses of 2 different long acting muscarinic antagonists against methacholine induced bronchoconstriction.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline methacholine bronchoprotection at 96 hours
primary_outcome.time_frame: pre treatment versus 96 hour post treatment
primary_outcome.description: assessed by dose shift of geometric mean methacholine PC20 data

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline methacholine bronchoprotection at 1 hour
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre treatment versus 1 hour post treatment
secondary_outcome.description: assessed by dose shift of geometric mean methacholine PC20 data

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline methacholine bronchoprotection at 24 hours
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre treatment versus 24 hours post treatment
secondary_outcome.description: assessed by dose shift of geometric mean methacholine PC20 data

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline methacholine bronchoprotection at 48 hours
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre treatment versus 48 hours post treatment
secondary_outcome.description: assessed by dose shift of geometric mean methacholine PC20 data

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline methacholine bronchoprotection at 72 hours
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre treatment versus 72 hours post treatment
secondary_outcome.description: assessed by dose shift of geometric mean methacholine PC20 data

arm_group.description: 2 inhalations of 2.5mcg/inhalation tiotropium from Respimat inhaler and 1 inhalation of placebo from Breezehaler 1 hour prior to methacholine challenge
1 inhalation of 50mcg glycopyrronium from Breezehaler and 2 inhalations from placebo Respimat inhaler 1 hour prior to methacholine challenge

intervention.description: inhaler device used to deliver active tiotropium or placebo
inhaler device used to deliver active glycopyrronium or placebo

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- male or female asthmatics > 19 years of age
- baseline methacholine PC20 less than or equal to 4mg/ml
- baseline lung function >65% predicted
- non-smoker and less than 10 pack year smoking history
Exclusion Criteria:
- use of anticholinergic within 30 days of Visit 1
- poorly controlled asthma
- pregnant or nursing
- respiratory illness within 4 weeks of Visit 1
- exposure to an agent that triggered asthma worsening (e.g. allergen) within 4 weeks of Visit 1
